name: CrowdStrike OAuth API
description: This app integrates with CrowdStrike OAuth2 authentication standard to implement querying of endpoint security data
latest_tested_versions: Cloud, API api.crowdstrike.com, January 21 2021, API version: v1, v2

max_events.description: Maximum events to get for scheduled and interval polling

max_events_poll_now.description: Maximum events to get while POLL NOW

merge_time_interval.description: Merge same containers within specified seconds

actions.description: Block the device
actions.verbose: This action contains the host, which stops any network communications to locations other than the CrowdStrike cloud and IPs specified in the user's containment policy.

actions.description: Unblock the device
actions.verbose: This action lifts containment on the host, which returns its network communications to normal.

actions.description: Assign one or more hosts to the static host group
Remove one or more hosts from the static host group
Initialize a new session with the Real Time Response cloud

device_id.description: Device ID for session to be created

example_values: Read a file from disk and display as ASCII or hex

C:\> cat c:\mytextfile.txt
        Display the contents of the text file (ASCII encoding)
    C:\> cat c:\windows\system32\cmd.exe 100 -ShowHex
        Display the first 100 hexadecimal characters for cmd.exe
View most recent N events in a given event log
Name of the event log, for example "Application", "System"

C:\> eventlog view Application 5
        Displays the 5 most recent event log entries in the "Application" event source log

actions.description: Deletes a Real Time Response session
Lists Real Time Response sessions
actions.verbose: This action supports filtering in order to retrieve a particular session.

limit.description: Maximum RTR sessions to be fetched

filter.description: Filter expression used to limit the fetched RTR sessions (FQL Syntax)

actions.description: Execute an active responder command on a single host
actions.verbose: The API works by first creating a cloud request to execute the command, then the results need to be retrieved using a GET with the cloud_request_id. The action will attempt to retrieve the results, but in the event that a timeout occurs, execute a 'get command details' action.

command.description: RTR command to execute on host

actions.description: Execute an RTR Admin command on a single host
actions.verbose: This action requires a token with RTR Admin permissions.

command.description: RTR Admin command to execute on host

actions.description: Retrieve results of an active responder command executed on a single host

timeout_seconds.description: Time (in seconds; default is 60) to wait before timing out poll for results

actions.description: Get a list of files for the specified RTR session
Get details on behaviors by providing behavior IDs

ids.description: List of behavior IDs. Comma separated list allowed

actions.description: Perform a set of actions on one or more incidents, such as adding tags or comments or updating the incident name or description

ids.description: List of incident IDs. Comma separated list allowed

add_tag.description: Adds the associated tag to all the incident(s) of the ids list. See example values for the defined list

delete_tag.description: Deletes the matching tag from all the incident(s) in the ids list. See example values for the defined list

update_name.description: Updates the name of all the incident(s) in the ids list

update_description.description: Updates the description of all the incident(s) listed in the ids

update_status.description: Updates the status of all the incident(s) in the ids list

add_comment.description: Adds a comment for all the incident(s) in the ids list

actions.description: Get information about all users in your Customer ID
Gets the roles that are assigned to the user

user_uuid.description: Users Unqiue ID to get the roles for

actions.description: Get information about all user roles from your Customer ID
Get information about all user roles from your Customer ID

role_id.description: Role ID to get information about. Comma separated list allowed

example_values: Can manage, create, update, and delete dashboards

actions.description: Query environment wide CrowdScore and return the entity data
actions.verbose: This action fetches crowdscores using pagination logic.

filter.description: Optional filter and sort criteria in the form of an FQL query

sort.description: Sort the results by a specific field and direction. (Example: assigned_to.asc)

offset.description: Starting index of overall result set from which to return ids. (Defaults to 0)

limit.description: Limit the number of results to return. (Defaults to 50, Max 500)

example_values: test is an invalid behavior sort parameter

Queries for custom indicators in your customer account

example_values: Total ip: 20, Total domain: 26, Total sha1: 0, Total md5: 0, Total sha256: 1, Alerts found: 47

actions.description: Queries for files uploaded to Crowdstrike for use with the RTR `put` command
actions.verbose: For additional information on FQL syntax see: https://falcon.crowdstrike.com/support/documentation/45/falcon-query-language-feature-guide.

offset.description: Starting index of overall result set

actions.description: Callback action for the on_poll ingest functionality
actions.verbose: This action remembers the last event ID that was queried for. The next ingestion carried out will query for later event IDs. This way, the same events are not queried for in every run. However, in the case of 'POLL NOW' queried event IDs will not be remembered.

actions.description: List processes that have recently used the IOC on a particular device
actions.verbose: Given a file hash or domain, the action will list all the processes that have either recently connected to the domain or interacted with the file that matches the supplied hash. Use the query device actions to get the device id to run the action on.

ioc.description: File Hash or Domain to use for searching

id.description: Crowdstrike Device ID to search on

actions.description: Upload one or more indicators that you want CrowdStrike to watch
actions.verbose:
Valid values for the policy parameter are:
  • detect
    Send a notification when the particular indicator has been detected on a host
  • none
    Take no action when the particular indicator has been detected on a host. This is equivalent to turning the indicator off.

As of this writing, the only valid value for the share_level parameter is red.
The expiration parameter is only valid for IP and Domains. As of this writing, if not specified, the Falcon API defaults to 30 days. If the indicator with the same type and value is created again, the action will pass successfully and the indicator will be overwritten.

ioc.description: Input domain, ip, or hash ioc

expiration.description: Alert lifetime in days (Valid for domains and ips only)

actions.description: Delete an indicator that is being watched

ioc.description: Hash, ip or domain IOC from previous upload

actions.description: Update an indicator that has been uploaded
actions.verbose: If no parameters are provided as input, the action would pass successfully.

ioc.description: Hash, ip or domain IOC to update

expiration.description: Alert lifetime in days (Valid for domains and ips only)
